meanings.definition: An opening or window in a building.
meanings.sent1: The sunlight streamed through the fenestra in the wall.
meanings.sent2: She looked out of the fenestra to see the birds flying by.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat squeezed through the fenestra and surprised everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a bright fenestra in the gloomy room.
meanings.sent5: The fenestra framed a picturesque view of the garden.

meanings.definition: A small opening or hole in a bone.
meanings.sent1: The doctor examined the tiny fenestra in the skull.
meanings.sent2: He pointed out the fenestra in the X-ray of the bone.
meanings.sent3: The mouse found a cozy spot to hide in the fenestra of the bone.
meanings.sent4: The crack in the wall resembled a fenestra in the ancient structure.
meanings.sent5: The fenestra allowed for the passage of nutrients within the bone.
